ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] 39th charm song
ygData.msgSnippet: Usually the first thing I ever do when I charm something is give it a /pet back off command to reset it s aggro list. Not only does /pet attack work every time
ygData.messageBody:
Usually the first thing I ever do when I charm something is give it a /pet
back off command to reset it's aggro list. Not only does /pet attack work
every time after you do a /pet back off (well it does for me), it will keep
your pet from attacking your party members, which I have seen numerous
times.

Sartori{Legion}
Veeshan


>From: "Reece Tom R CPT 25 ID L G4(n)" <g4mntofcr@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@egroups.com
>To: EQBards <eqbards@egroups.com>
>Subject: [eqbards] 39th charm song
>Date: Mon, 23 Oct 2000 08:07:46 -1000
>
>I started playing my bard again after a 4 month break. The lute strings
>required a little fine tuning but it wasn't too hard to get back in the
>swing of things. One thing I did have trouble with was using this song.
>
>I had just dinged into 39 when I stopped playing the first time. So I
>never
>had the opportunity to use this song. Here is the problem I had. Group
>would pull two mobs and I would charm the second one. I would get the eyes
>glaze over message. I would then target the first mob and give the /pet
>attack command. Problem is my pet just stood there and did not attack. I
>kept hitting /pet attack on several occasions but I could never get it to
>work. In this situation, the mob we were attacking never attacked me.
>
>So then later on I tried it again. Different scenario this time. Puller
>agrroed two mobs and snared one. So the second mob took longer to arrive
>at
>the party. I was attacking first mob, buffing party etc before the second
>mob got there. I charmed second mob when it arrived, initial mob attacked
>me, and then my pet responded and started attacking the first mob. After
>charm wore off and I recharmed it, it automatically attacked the first mob
>again.
>
>Not certain why I could not get my charmed mob to attack in the first
>situation. Besides the mana drain, is there a difference how the 39 charm
>works compared to the original version?
>
>Galtin of E'ci
